intro: Althenia bilocularis, commonly known as the two-chambered althenia, is a lesser-known flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that typically bloom in shades of violet or purple. The plant has opposite leaves that are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs. Althenia bilocularis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and unique floral structure, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
